description: Sven Halek finalizes a speech for Council review, urging leaders to embrace the chaos of merged BCI identities as a chance for radical empathy and collective renewal, rather than push for a divisive system reset.

A citywide message shaped by Sven highlights stories of former high- and low-score citizens sharing privileges and memories as BCI boundaries blur. Assemblies encourage dialogue and curiosity instead of panic.

Council reviews reports of peaceful collaboration and growing empathy in neighborhoods. Sven's messaging leads Council to delay any abrupt intervention, letting grassroots assemblies adapt to shifting realities.
Assemblies organize citywide open listening sessions to help residents share experiences, process confusion about identity shifts, and propose directions for Stenograd's future. Participation surges.

Following weeks of listening sessions, residents and assemblies vote to preserve the blended, empathic order. Rada Miskovic broadcasts a hidden message from Halden, confirming his gamble on collective humanity over surveillance.
